intro: Arkezostis racemosa, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, giving it its species name "racemosa." It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its adaptive features, it is considered a resilient plant in harsh climates.
